response.job_title: Mechanical Designer at Toshiba Energy Systems 機械設計担当者
response.summary:
You can write about your years of experience, industry, or skills. People also talk about their achievements or previous job experiences.
Mechanical Engineer from the National University of Colombia. I finished my master's degree in semi-organic Solar Cells at the University of Tokyo, Japan with the Monbokagakusho Scholarship. Currently working as a Hydropower Turbine Generator designer at Toshiba Energy Systems and Solutions in Yokohama, Japan. For five years I have been in charge of the detailed mechanical design and final specifications for the production of Hydropower generators. My role starts with the mechanical design and improvement of current technologies and reaches the final procedures of assembly of the machine, also dealing with the customer and any possible non-conformity in the process. Self-challenger. Always finding new ways to do things simplest and better. I enjoy finding something to learn about different people's cultures and languages. Flexible to changes and at this moment I am looking for new tasks that impel me to go further as a professional.
response.skills: AutoCAD, Computer-Aided Design (CAD), Communication, Fluid Mechanics, SOLIDWORKS, machining learning, Engineering, Energy Systems, Organic Solar Cells, Pyrolysis, Hydropower, Foreign Languages, English, japanese, Brazilian Portuguese, Detailed Design, Cross-functional Team Leadership, C (Programming Language), Python (Programming Language), Siemens NX

profile_positions.location: 日本 神奈川県 横浜
profile_positions.description:
Currently working in the design department for hydropower generators of Toshiba Energy Systems. 
I am in charge of the detailed mechanical design and final specifications for the production of Hydropgenerators. My role starts with the mechanical design and reaches the final procedures of assembly of the machine, also dealing with the customer and any possible non-conformity in the process.

company.name: Toshiba
company.description:
About Toshiba Group

For over 140 years, Toshiba Group has contributed to a sustainable future by applying innovative technologies to value creation. Today, our business domains center on energy, social infrastructure, electronic devices and digital solutions, all essential supports for modern life and society. Guided by the principles of The Basic Commitment of the Toshiba Group, “Committed to People, Committed to the Future”, Toshiba Group promotes global operations that contribute to the realization of a world where generations to come can live better lives.

More information is available at https://www.toshiba.co.jp/worldwide/
Catch up with our latest news: https://www.toshiba.co.jp/about/press/index.htm
Catch up with our latest stories: https://www.toshiba-clip.com/en/
